chav1961.purelib.streams.char2byte

Class AsmWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Writer
      • chav1961.purelib.streams.char2byte.AsmWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, Appendable, AutoCloseable

    public class AsmWriter
extends Writer

    This class is a Java byte code Assembler. It implements as an usual Writer:

    try(final OutputStream os = ...;
    final Writer wr = new AsmWriter(os);{
    wr.write(" .package mypackage\n");
    wr.write("Test .class public\n");
    . . .
    wr.write("Test .end\n");
    }

    After closing streams, output stream will contain ready-to-use class description, and you can pass it to ClassLoader.defineClass(String,byte[],int,int) protected method to create new class in the JVM. Syntax of the assembler instructions and pseudocommands will be described later

    Current version of the class implements Java 1.7-compatible class file format with some restrictions:

    • byte code commands invokedynamic and wide are not supported in the current version (I have no any plans to support invokedynamic, but wide will be implemented soon)
    • debugging information (source file, line numbers etc) are not included in the class file

    Any syntax or semantic errors in the source will produce an IOException. The Throwable.getCause() method will return an instance of SyntaxException in this case.

    Don't use this class in the PrintWriter or PrintStream classes, because these classes always suppress any I/O exceptions on it's methods, so you can loose your assembler error when you use it

    I not guarantee, that this implementation is free of any bugs, and nice to get any feedback about

    This class is not thread-safe

    Since:
    0.0.1 last update 0.0.2
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    ClassLoader, JUnit tests

        public AsmWriter clone(OutputStream os)
                throws NullPointerException,
                       IllegalStateException,
                       IOException

        Clone writer with all imports and macros were defined earlier. Uses to reduce time and resources for new instances of the AsmWriter

        Parameters:
        os - output stream to write content to
        Returns:
        new writer instance
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when output stream is null
        IllegalStateException - when output stream is null
